meanings.definition: Belonging to a subdivision of a species.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the subspecific differences between the two bird populations.
meanings.sent2: The subspecific characteristics of the new plant species were carefully documented.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the subspecific variations in the color patterns of the butterflies.
meanings.sent4: The subspecific traits of the flowers bloomed brightly in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The subspecific features of the fish made them easy to identify.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a subspecies.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper cared for the subspecific animals with great dedication.
meanings.sent2: The subspecific classification helped in understanding the unique characteristics of the species.
meanings.sent3: The subspecific group of monkeys had a hilarious way of swinging from tree to tree.
meanings.sent4: Her subspecific talents shone brightly in the music industry.
meanings.sent5: The subspecific markings on the bird's feathers were truly mesmerizing.
